cab.content: [This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government, aricl should be returned to the Foreign Office if not required for official use.] HI.mSmJ0^ POLITICALQCpDi-copy of Cypher telegram to Commander-in-Chief, (Mediterranean) from the Admiralty. D, 7.26 p.m. 25th September, 1922.No.997. Personal from Chief of Naval Staff. Request your views as to what could be done by Navy tointerfere with Kemalist advance in Ismid Peninsula, have discussed matter with Rear Admiral Webb who points out that southern Road and Railway and Northern Road to Shile could bekept under fire from the sea, also that road newly construct-ed inland and not marked in our maps could be subjected toindirect fire with aeroplane spotting and to bombing byaeroplanes. Possibility of erecting 6" guns on one of PrincesIslands might be considered. What do you propose to do with6" and 4" guns being sent you from England.
